item.title: Pool abandoned in public area, 27th December
item.description:
This pool was used by one of the neighbors over the summer but they have since left it abandoned in the public area. It is collecting moss, and doing damage to the grass underneath. Would appreciate if it can be removed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kidbrooke Park Close, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeat dog mess on pavement, 27th December
item.description:
I am getting fed up of the constant dog fouling on the pavement on Pickford Lane. Huge piles almost daily! Across the road from the butchers it is everywhere. When is something going to be done about putting a stop to it? It is obviously the same person!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Pickford Lane, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Https://maps.app.goo.gl/1LRufubeV9fLqFKe7 or 51°32'09.2"N 0°08'49.1"W (the pothole on the LHS of the road as you cycle northeast out of Regent's Park via Gloucester Gate at the second set of traffic lights (on the bridge after the fountain), 27th December
item.description:
This pothole is sunken right down into the tarmac. It's in the secondary position when you're cycling exactly on the kerb, meaning it's in the way when you're trying to filter up the kerb to get to the advance stop line. I know you're going to dig this whole area up anyway... But this pothole is super annoying because it stops you filtering (too big to cycle through) and so leaves you stuck at the back of the traffic queue (can't reach the front with the bike box and advanced stop line). I feel like I'm going to get a puncture if I ride over it, so I end up waiting behind and stuck with the cars. Would love it fixed, thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Avenue, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The footway has not been swept at all, 27th December
item.description:
From Bowness Road to Haslemere Road both sides including the enclosed footbridge, has not been swept for what looks like a year or more and looks a complete mess. Can this be swept properly as that section of the road looks completely unkempt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 92, Long Lane, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip hazard on pavement, 27th December
item.description:
On west pavement outside 119 & 121 Alleyn Park: stump of a signpost installed by Southwark Council, which recently fell because of corrosion. The stump remaining is a moderate trip hazard: it needs to be removed, and the hole filled with tarmac.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alleyn Park, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
